name: Travelodge by the Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 days at the Travelodge. It has a good location and not too far to walk to Pier 39 & Fisherman's Wharf. It is a budget accomodation so don't expect 5 star. But if you only want a bed to sleep in & plan on being out & about all day, this is the place for you. It's clean & tidy & the bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: Cheap accomodation

reviews.text: We found this motel when we had no other place to turn. First and foremost , if you've never been to SanFransico before BE WARNED, PARKING IS AN ABSOLUTE PREMIUM!!!!!!! We were booked in at the Ramada just down the street. Arrived about two O clock in the afternoon and they could not porovide us with a parking spot(Only a dozen spots for probably over 50 ROOMS!!!)
reviews.title: Could provide us parking when no one else could

likes.liked: — They could provide us with parking
likes.disliked: — the rooms were a bit tired and outdated, But clean

reviews.text: We explained to the desk clerk that we would not stay unless he could provide a spot for our vehicle. No luck! So we cancelled our reservation, and found the travelodge who for a small cost could provide us with a spot to park. We found it to be more than adeqaute for our needs, clean comfortable and we felt safe. Location was good also. There is a small diner about two doors down the street which was has very good food and good service.
reviews.title: Medicocre experience

reviews.text: We arrived late and got the last parking spot which was very tight and hard to get in and out of. We checked in and our room was ok. It's one of those rooms that you can't really find anything wrong with but you just don't feel quite comfortable. At bedtime we could not sleep because the walls are paper thin and the guy beside us was snoring sooo loud we felt like he was in bed with us. We tried sleeping the opposite way on the bed, but no luck, so eventually we had to call front desk and switch rooms. (I have never done this before!) They gave us a way nicer, cleaner, quieter room the second time. It was fine, and if my original experience was the second room I would have a lot more nice things to say. It wasn't fun carting suitcases at 11:30pm.. but oh well. The next day we were able to walk to most of the famous downtown sites from our hotel. Walking distance to the Crookedest Street, Pier and cable cars. I guess we paid more for location.. because I wouldn't say it was a $100 room!
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

aka: Travelodge By The Bay Hotel San Francisco
